contentrichtext.text: {{Cleanup|date=March 2009}} {{Infobox settlement |official_name = Zunil |image_skyline = zunil guatemala panorama.JPG |imagesize = 300px |image_caption = Panorama, 2009 |pushpin_map = Guatemala<!-- the name of a location map as per http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Template:Location_map --> |pushpin_label_position =bottom |pushpin_map_caption =Location in Guatemala |coordinates_region = GT |subdivision_type = Country |subdivision_name = [[Image:Flag of Guatemala.svg|25px]] [[Guatemala]] |subdivision_type1 = Admin. division |subdivision_name1 = [[Zacapa Department]] |leader_title = [[Mayor]] |leader_name = Jose Maria Chaj (2012-2016) |area_total_km2 = 92 |population_as_of = 2011 Estimate |population_total = 12,356 |population_density_km2 = 134.30 |latd=14 |latm=47 |lats= |latNS=N |longd=91|longm=29 |longs= |longEW=W }} '''Zunil''' is a [[municipality]] in the [[Quetzaltenango Department|Quetzaltenango]] [[Departments of Guatemala|department]] of [[Guatemala]] with a surface area of {{convert|92|km2|sqmi}}.<ref name="inforpessca">[http://www.inforpressca.com/zunil Zunil at Inforpressca]</ref> Zunil is located {{convert|9|km|mi}} from the city of [[Quetzaltenango, Quetzaltenango|Quetzaltenango]], on the bank of the [[Salamá River]].<ref name="Cat36">Cattelan 2004, p.36.</ref> Zunil has an altitude of approximately {{convert|2075|m|ft}} [[above mean sea level]].<ref name="Cat36"/> The population is about 14,000 people, 100% indigenous. The inhabitants speak [[K'iche' language|K'iche']] and [[Spanish language|Spanish]].<ref name="inforpessca"/> Zunil possesses active worship of '''''San Simón''''' (also known as [[Maximón]]), a life-sized mannequin representing a [[Maya peoples|Maya]] god, sitting in a wooden throne, which is moved to a different house every year, and many people visit and leave gifts at his shrine. There are thermal baths with volcanic water around the town, for example [[Fuentes Georginas]] and [[Almolonga, Quetzaltenango|Almolonga]]. [[Zunil (crater)|A crater]] on [[Mars]], which may be the source of [[Mars meteorite]]s, is named after the village.<ref>{{cite journal|author=McEwan, A.S. ''et al.''|url=http://www.mars.asu.edu/christensen/classdocs/mcewen_zunil_Icarus_2005.pdf|title=The rayed crater Zunil and interpretations of small impact craters on Mars|journal=[[Icarus (journal)|Icarus]]|volume=176|pages=351–381|year=2005|accessdate=2006-09-08|doi=10.1016/j.icarus.2005.02.009|bibcode=2005Icar..176..351M|issue=2}}.</ref> ==Gallery== <gallery> File:indoor market zunil guatemala.JPG|Indoor market File:Zunil_church.JPG|Church in Zunil File:Zunil panorama.JPG|Panorama of Zunil Image:Zunil buses.JPG|Buses in Zunil </gallery> ==Notes== {{reflist}} ==References== *{{cite book |author={{aut|Cattelan, Marino}} |year=2004 |title=Quetzaltenango |location=Guatemala |publisher=Xibalbá Publicaciones}} == External links == {{coord|14|47|N|91|29|W|region:GT_type:city|display=title}} {{commons category|Zunil}} *[http://www.inforpressca.com/zunil Zunil at Inforpressca] *[http://www.lasfuentesgeorginas.com/history.htm Fuentes Georginas] {{Quetzaltenango Department}} [[Category:Municipalities of the Quetzaltenango Department]] [[Category:Populated places in Guatemala]] {{Guatemala-geo-stub}}
